result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey J. Corcoran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

SAFE program intake, assessment and follow through. 

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample. 

60/90/120 day probation review hearings. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey J. Corcoran

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 1:30 p.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1311, 22CF206, 22CF553, 22CF986, 22CM140.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 

Date and time set for JPTC; VRCW. 
Parties ready to proceed to plea. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CF1311>>State moves to revoke DEOJ Agreement on Count 2 (Battery/Domestic Abuse); Court grants and enters judgment. 

22CF206>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/DA Assessment)
COURT grants. 

22CF553>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/DA Assessment)
Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct/DA)
Count 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA)
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/DA Assessment)
COURT grants. 

22CF986>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/DA Assessment)
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/DA Assessment)
COURT grants.  

22CM140>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/DA Assessment)
COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

22CF206 Count 1 (Stalking/DA)>>GUILTY.  

22CF553 Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/DA Assessments)>>GUILTY. 

22CF986:
Count 1 (Stalking/DA)>>GUILTY.  
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/DA Assessment)>>GUILTY.  
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/DA Assessment)>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 21CF1311 Count 2:  8 months MCJ; 45 days to report.  No objection for huber or EMP for work.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge.  COURT grants 3 days credit.  

COURT ORDERS on all other counts: SWH for 5 years probation; concurrent with each other. 
CONDITIONS:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program intake, assessment and follow through.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  120 days MCJ I/S for rules violations in 22CF553, Count 4 only.  30 hour community service I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharges.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings. 

Probation review hearing>>12/16/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  1:54 p.m.

records.addlTxt: NON WAIVABLE No contact with victim(s): B.C., C.C. & H.C. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:12 pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.  Deft appears from MCJ, and w/Atty Dave Casey.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

COURT ORDERS: $5,000 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- NON WAIVABLE No contact with victim(s): B.C., C.C. & H.C. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
